info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 4 at 11:26AM CDT until July 5 at 1:45AM CDT by NWS San Angelo TX
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in San Angelo TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas...
North Concho River Near Carlsbad affecting Tom Green County.
For the North Concho River...including Sterling City, Carlsbad... Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...North Concho River near Carlsbad.
* WHEN...From this morning to just after midnight tonight.
* IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding will occur to ranch land along the river. Secondary roads and low water crossings will be flooded.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM CDT Friday the stage was 12.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 10.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:30 AM CDT Friday was 12.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 12.2 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage this afternoon. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.6 feet on 04/30/1966. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
To escape rising water, take the shortest path to higher ground.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued this evening at 1130 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT
